intro: Cyanea hamatiflora subsp. carlsonii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has succulent-like leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its floral structure includes five petals and stamens, typical of the hibiscus family. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
